title: american_civil_war
body:
A civil [[war]] between the North (Union) and South ([[Confederate States of America]]) of the [[United states|United States]], which lasted from 1861 to 1865. The war's cause was the issue of [[slave]]ry, in which the Southern Confederate states refused to abolish slavery and seceded from the Union.

h4. See also

* [[tag_group:history]]

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Civil_War

title: ku_klux_klan
body:
A [[racism|white supremacist]] group originating in the Southern United States in the aftermath of the [[American Civil War]] as a backlash against the newly freed slaves, then revived in the 1920s and again after WWII. Infamous for their [[white hood]]s, burning crosses, lynchings and others murders.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ku_Klux_Klan]

title: confederate_flag
body:
Dating to the [[American Civil War]], the flag popularly known as the confederate flag was the battle flag used by the [[Confederate States of America]]'s Army of Northern Virginia, and was also used as the CSA's naval ensign displayed as a smaller canton with a white field.

Contrary to popular belief, it was never used as the national flag of the Confederacy, nor was it used by any of the Confederacy's armies west of Virginia. It is sometimes mistakenly called "Stars and Bars", which was the nickname of the actual first national flag of the Confederate States.

After the war, the ANV battle flag was adopted by many pro-Confederate groups, leading to its status as a divisive symbol today. In modern days, the flags are associated with white supremacy and [[racism]] in a similar vein to the [[Nazi flag]].

All flags connected to the Confederate States other than the aformentioned flag could be also be given the 'confederate_flag' tag.

h4. See also
* [[Ku Klux Klan]]
other_names: アメリカ連合国の国旗

title: confederate_states_of_america
body:
The [b]Confederate States of America (CSA)[/b] was a secessionist state that existed from 1861 to 1865, it was formed when a number of states from the [[United States]] of America decided to secede from the union in the name of State's rights to [[slave]]ry. Ultimately, a total of 11 states join the Confederacy. Not recognized by any major country during its brief existence.

Use this tag when the post directly refer to the CSA, such as its military during the [[American Civil War]]. Do not apply this tag if the post simply featuring the [[Confederate flag]] as a motif.

h4. See also
* [[American Civil War]]
* [[Confederate flag]]
* [[Ku Klux Klan]]

title: 9/11_tourist_guy_(meme)
body:
A hoax that featured a digitally altered photograph of a tourist on the observation deck of the [[World Trade Center]], supposedly on the day of the [[9/11|September 11 attacks]], showing a plane about to hit the tower in the background.

The photo became an Internet phenomenon as many manipulated pictures spread online. The man in the photograph was ultimately identified as Hungarian Péter Guzli, who took the photo in 1997. Guzli said he edited the photo as a joke for his friends and did not realize it would spread across the Internet.

h4.See also

* "Original hoax photo":https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/0/05/Tourist_guy.jpg

title: stepan_(number-seventeen)
body:
Stepan is a male Ukrainian character belonging to the 67th Mechanized Brigade, a [[Right Sector]]-derivative unit.

He is often depicted with a [[jacket]], [[baggy pants]], [[boots]], [[gloves]], and a [[blue beanie|blue]] [[beanie]]. His weapon of choice is an [[AK-47]].

Created by [[Biswapriya Purkayastha]] in 2022 to mock Ukrainian ultranationalists in the comic [i]Tales of Ukranazistan[/i] after the [[russo-ukrainian war|2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine]] began, his original full name was "Ukranazi Stepan". [[Marichka]]'s newfound notoriety on /pol/ inspired [[Number-Seventeen]] to draw Stepan as an aesthetically-appealing character to ship with her in a series of comics, with his rather-unbelievable backstory utterly unchanged. LapisLumos' and [[Linyvets chan]]'s contributions gave Stepan [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and greater depth, fully diverging the character from the original.

h4. External links

* "Marichka Wiki (English)":https://marichka.fandom.com/wiki/Stepan
* "Marichka Wiki (Ukrainian)":https://marichka.fandom.com/uk/wiki/%D0%A1%D1%82%D0%B5%D0%BF%D0%B0%D0%BD
* "Original Comic's Telegram":https://t.me/TalesOfUkranazistan
* "Original Author's Wordpress":https://ragheadthefiendlyterrorist.wordpress.com/
* "Original Author's Blogspot (inactive)":https://bill-purkayastha.blogspot.com/

body:
[b]Hokkaido[/b] is the largest prefecture in Japan and the largest of the northern islands. Its capital is [[Sapporo (city)|]].

Shorthand for September 11, [[2001]]. A [[terrorism|terrorist attack]] involving two planes hijacked by Al-Qaeda [[terrorist]]s flew into the [[World Trade Center|Twin Towers]], causing them to collapse top-down onto the streets of [[New York City]]. Another plane was flown into the Pentagon building in Arlington, Virginia while a fourth, presumed to be targeting somewhere in [[Washington D.C.]] was deliberately crashed near Shanksville, Pennsylvania as its passengers fought to regain control from the terrorists. The death toll is currently at 2,996, including 17 hijackers.

The event is widely considered by Americans to be the true start of the 2000s, as well as a catalyst of the "War on Terror", a series of armed involvement of the US and allies in the middle east under the pretext of eliminating terrorism. Chief among these conflicts were as the [[War in Afghanistan|American invasion of Afghanistan in 2001]] and [[Iraq War|Iraq in 2003]], and to an extent, the [[Syrian Civil War]].

Due to various factors, the event has spawned numerous jokes and [[meme]]s. The earliest was about various conspiracy theory alleged that the event was an inside job orchestrated by then-US President [[george w. bush|George W. Bush]] as a [i]casus belli[/i] for the war in the middle east, such as "Bush did 9/11" and "jet fuel don't melt steel beams". Though later on, 9/11 imagery or reference has gained resurgence as a part of Gen Z humor, primarily for the shock value or as an "edgy" punchline.

The most common depiction of the event depicts [[smoke]] exiting either of the towers.

h4. See also

* [[9/11 tourist guy (meme)]]
* [[A second plane has hit the x (meme)]]
* [[War in Afghanistan]]
* [[Iraq War]]
* [[World Trade Center]]
* [[Osama Bin Laden]]
* [[Tag group:history]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: September 11 attacks":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/September_11_attacks]

title: lattice_dragonmaid
body:
[b]Level[/b]: 8
[b]Attribute[/b]: LIGHT
[b]Type[/b]: Dragon / Fusion / Effect

[i]2 "Dragonmaid" monsters with the same Attribute but different Levels
Must first be Special Summoned (from your Extra Deck) by banishing 1 each of the above cards from your field and GY. You can only use each of the following effects of "Lattice Dragonmaid" once per turn. If this card is Special Summoned: You can Special Summon 1 Level 4 or lower "Dragonmaid" monster from your Deck. During the Standby Phase: You can Fusion Summon 1 Dragon Fusion Monster from your Extra Deck, by shuffling its materials from your field and/or banishment into the Deck.[/i]

[b]ATK[/b]: 2000 
[b]DEF[/b]: 3000

A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]] and one of the member of the Dragonmaid archetype. She is first introduced in 2024 and is currently the newest member of the archetype.

She is frequently paired with [[Chamber Dragonmaid]] in fanarts, typically as Chamber's one-sided "rival". This is due to her debut overshadowed Chamber receiving [[Dragonmaid Stern|her long anticipated dragon form]] that were introduced in the same set.
other_names: ドラゴンメイド・ラティス

title: dragonmaid_sheou
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 10
[b]Attribute:[/b] Light
[b]Type:[/b] Dragon / Fusion / Effect
[i]
1 "Dragonmaid" monster + 1 Level 5 or higher Dragon monster
During each Standby Phase: You can Special Summon 1 Level 9 or lower "Dragonmaid" monster from your hand or GY. When your opponent activates a card or effect (Quick Effect): You can negate the activation, and if you do, destroy that card, also, after that, return this card to the Extra Deck, and if you do, Special Summon 1 "House Dragonmaid" from your Extra Deck. You can only use each effect of "Dragonmaid Sheou" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 3500
[b]DEF:[/b] 2000


A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]] and one of the member of the Dragonmaid archetype. She is [[dragon]] form of [[House Dragonmaid]]. Unlike the other maid, [[Dragonmaid Sheou]] is currently the only bipedal dragon in the Dragonmaid archetype. She also has the highest Level (10) and original ATK (3500) of all Dragonmaid dragon form. Although Dragonmaid Sheou has Light attribute, her scale color is black, which is more likely Dark attribute monsters' color.
other_names: ドラゴンメイド・シュトラール

title: philia_regis
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 8
[b]Attribute:[/b] Dark
[b]Type:[/b] Dragon / Fusion / Effect

1 Dragon Fusion Monster + 1 Level 7 or higher Dragon monster
During the Main Phase (Quick Effect): You can target 1 card your opponent controls or in their GY; banish it, then, if it was banished from the field, return 1 Dragon monster you control to the hand. At the start of your opponent's Battle Phase, if this card is in your GY: You can return 1 Dragon monster you control to the hand/Extra Deck, and if you do, Special Summon this card. You can only use each effect of "Philia Regis" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 3000

A new [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]] featured in the Alliance Insight core booster box. [[Philia Regis]] is likely an indirect support to Dragonmaid archetype, due to being a Dragon Fusion Monster with effects that rely on returning Dragon monsters from the field to the hand.

title: genjitsu_no_yohane
body:
In English, [i]Yohane the Parhelion[/i]. Also subtitled [i]Sunshine in the Mirror[/i], it is a [i][[Love Live! Sunshine!!]][/i] fantasy spin-off with an anime that debuted in 2023.

The first mention of an anime was as an April Fool's 2022 joke on the official [i]Love Live![/i] YouTube channel (the original has since been deleted from the official channel, but not before being "translated":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XSflX-60EAI]). On June 26, 2022, a "separate dedicated twitter account":[https://twitter.com/GJ_yohane/status/1541041754958630913] as well as a live announcement at an Aqours live confirmed that the spin-off was in the works.

The series casts Aqours in a completely new setting, set in a fantasy world version in the land of "Numazu", named after the Shizuoka Prefecture city and its surroundings (including Uchiura) that [i]Sunshine!![/i] is set in, and stars [[Tsushima Yoshiko]] as [[Yohane (genjitsu no yohane)|]] (Yoshiko's preferred fallen angel name). It tells "the story that no one knows about a girl that everyone knows," where she journeys and meets fantasy versions of other characters.

In June 2023, "[i]Blaze in the Deepblue[/i]":[http://yohane-bid.com/en/], a 2D action platform video game for the series in the vein of [i][[Metroid]][/i] and [i][[Castlevania (series)|]][/i], was announced after it itself was an April Fool's joke in 2023. Developed by Inti Creates, it is the first [i]Love Live![/i] console game released November 16, 2023 for [[Nintendo Switch]], [[PlayStation 4]] and [[PlayStation 5|5]], [[Xbox One]] and [[Xbox Series X|Series X/S]] and [[Steam (platform)|]].

title: savior_(eversoul)
body:
The player character and protagonist of [[Eversoul]].

He was once just a normal human from 21st century Earth, until one day, he was suddenly summoned to Eden (an alternate Earth set in the distant future) by the summoning ritual of the Souls [[Mephistopheles (Eversoul)|]] and Queen [[Yuria (Eversoul)|]] to be chosen as the Savior of Souls and the new administrator of the first Ark "Metatron". He holds Dominion over Soul Mastery, allowing him to create mutual contracts with Souls wherein they gain greater power than before in exchange for them assisting him in battles when needed, though his physiological disadvantages as a normal human and his general lack of experience prevents him from fully utilizing his power.

He's currently the only human on the Souls' side of the war against the Gates and also the only "old" human (Homo sapiens) within the setting. [spoilers]He would later become one of two humans aided by Souls in fighting against the predestined apocalypse alongside former enemy and fellow Soul Master Kayrin Faust.[/spoilers]

[spoiler]His true role is later revealed to be the Singularity, a special being chosen by the universe to hold the innate ability to defy conventional space-time laws and create branches in time with each choice they confront while also being the telltale sign of their world's imminent apocalypse once certain conditions are met.[/spoiler]

h4. Appearance
* !post #5875427: Key visual
* !post #5860306: Key visual
He is a young human man, presumably in between his late teens to early adulthood, with [[brown hair]] and [[grey eyes]]. His usual attire mostly follows the same color scheme as Mephi and Yuria, consisting of him wearing a [[black shirt|black]] [[turtleneck]] shirt under a [[white coat]] with various [[gold|golden]] [[jewelry]] and a [[single pauldron|single]] golden [[pauldron]] on his left shoulder, followed by [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]], [[white pants]] and [[white footwear|boots]]. He's usually seen with a small [[cane]] either held by his left hand or strapped to his waist, which he uses both as a blunt weapon and a magic tool for his Soul Master abilities.

His face has only been shown in his in-game portrait, promotional art, and 3D in-game cutscenes. Most CGs that show him usually keep his [[head out of frame]] as per his role as a self-insert character.

She is a parody of [[Hisui (cookie)|]], with a [[:3]] mouth and [[solid circle eyes]], very simple [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]], one hand doing a [[v]] with the other [[arm behind back|hand either behind her back]] or [[amputee|amputated]]. To compensate her being drawn extremely simple, she is animated very well often using [[rotoscoping]]. Other Cookie characters use motion tweens or MMD models with canned animations; Fake Hisui is hand-animated. Another common joke is giving her [[large breasts|larger breasts]] than Hisui.

title: noel_vermillion
body:
Female character from [i][[BlazBlue]][/i].

Noel Vermillion is a lieutenant of the NOL (Novus Orbis Librarium), who dual-wields a set of handguns named Arcus Diabolus Bolverk. She works as a direct subordinate of Major [[Jin Kisaragi]].

Her hobbies include online shopping and poetry (she refuses to show others her poems). She deeply dislikes insects.

She [[dual wielding|wields]] the Nox Nyctores [[Bolverk]].

Voiced in Japanese by [[Kondou Kanako]] and English by [[Cristina Valenzuela]].

title: v
body:
Making a '[b]V[/b]' shape with the index and middle finger, like this: ✌️. Use [[W]] instead if the thumb is open too.

Most of the time it's simply a visual equivalent of "yo!", something you make when posing for pictures. It is sometimes called "peace sign" or "V sign" or "victory sign".

In the case of the circular peace sign (☮) then [[peace_symbol|peace symbol]] should be used instead.

title: strike_witches
body:
[b]Strike Witches[/b] is a light novel and anime series set in an alternate [[World War II]] setting in which the nations of the world band together to defend against an alien invasion. Their only trump cards are witches (genderswapped versions of real life World War II fighter pilots) who don engine-shaped leggings known as [[striker unit]]s to fly and do battle in the sky. 

The series later spawned several sequels and spin-offs, which were later collectively named the [[World Witches Series]].

*Written by [[Yamaguchi Noboru]]

title: piranimon
body:
A vicious Aquatic Digimon that acts in large schools. The exoskeleton that covers Piranimon’s head enhances the power of its jaws, helping it to crush foes with its sharp fangs. The sheer power of its bite is said to rival Mammothmon’s stomp.
Piranimon uses Cruel Invitation to run through prey with its fishhook-like tail and drag them into the water. Then it clamps down on them with its bite and rapidly spins around with Calamity Vise, riddling their body with holes as it finishes them off. Since Piranimon target lone Digimon and attack in groups, they leave behind no trace of their prey’s data.

title: qixie
body:
[[Chinese clothes|Chinese]] [[platform footwear]] that originates from [[Manchu clothes|Manchu]]. Also called "Manchu platform shoes".

h4. Examples
* !post #8472299


h4. Trivia
* The shape of these heels can vary. There are types that imitate the thick, outward-curve shape of [[yuanbao]] (sycee). There is a shape that curves inwards like a 'horseshoe', and other shapes described as 'vase'-like or 'flowerpot'-like.

* Historically, unlike Han Chinese women, the aristocratic Manchu women of China did not bind their feet by tradition, but wore platformed shoes. There are several theories behind wearing this footwear, from keeping their clothing clean, to protecting their feet from insect bites.


h4. See also

* [[Paduka]] (Ancient Indian footwear)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Manchu Platform shoes":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manchu_platform_shoes]

title: weezer_(band)
body:
An American rock band formed in [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], in 1992. The [[band (music)|]] was founded by lead vocalist and guitarist Rivers Cuomo, alongside former bassist Matt Sharp, drummer Patrick Wilson, and former member Jason Cropper. Weezer gained popularity in the mid-1990s with their self-titled debut album, often referred to as the "Blue Album," which featured hit songs like "Buddy Holly," "Undone - The Sweater Song," and "Say It Ain't So."

Known for their catchy melodies, power-pop hooks, and a mix of alternative and pop-rock sound, Weezer has released several successful albums over the years. Some of their notable hits include "Hash Pipe," "Island in the Sun," "Beverly Hills," and "Pork and Beans." They have developed a devoted fanbase and have remained active in the music industry, releasing new music and touring consistently.

h4. Albums

* [[Weezer (Blue Album)]] (1994)
* [[Pinkerton (Weezer)|]] (1996)
* [[Weezer (Green Album)]] (2001)
* Maladroit (2002)
* Make Believe (2005)
* [[Weezer (Red Album)]] (2008)
* [[Raditude (album)|]] (2009)
* Hurley (2010)
* Everything Will Be Alright in the End (2014)
* Weezer (White Album) (2016)
* Pacific Daydream (2017)
* Weezer (Teal Album) (2019)
* Weezer (Black Album) (2019)
* OK Human (2019)
* Van Weezer (2021)

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Weezer":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weezer]

title: screentones
body:
Screentone is a technique for applying textures and shades to drawings, used as an alternative to [[hatching (texture)|]]. In the conventional process, patterns are transferred to paper from preprinted sheets, but the technique is also simulated in computer graphics, notably in Flipnote Studio and Macpaint.

[[Ben-Day dots]] is a type of screentone. 

h4. See also

* [[halftone]]
* [[dithering]]
* [[moire]]
* [[unmoving pattern]]

title: momosuzu_nene_(cheerleader)
body:
The 4th/[[Cheerleader]] [[official alternate costume| costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Momosuzu Nene]], debuting on June 10th, 2023. Unlike her past outfits that were designed by her original artist ([[Nishizawa]]), this one was designed by [[Anmi]].

It consisting of a [[pink headwear|pink]] [[sideways hat|sideways]] [[visor cap]], a [[frilled choker|frilled]] [[pink choker]], either a [[crop top|cropped]] [[white tank top]] with her name [[clothes writing|written on it]] with a [[pink sash|pink]] [[frilled sash]] going from her right shoulder to her left armpit or a [[white shirt|white]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[off-shoulder shirt]], pink [[arm garter]]s and [[wrist cuffs]], a [[layered skirt|layered]] [[pink skirt|pink]] [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[waist bow|waist]] [[bow skirt|bow]] and a [[Nekko (momosuzu nene)|]] [[character doll|doll]], [[white thighhighs]] and [[white footwear]] [[inline skates]].

For her 3rd anniversary on December 2023 she got an optional [[red capelet|red]] [[fur-trimmed capelet]] with a [[brown ribbon|brown]] [[neck ribbon|ribbon]] and a [[crown]] formed by multiple [[Nekko (momosuzu nene)|]]. On May 2024 to celebrate her 1000th video on YouTube she got an optional [[blue shirt|blue]] [[cropped shirt]] with [[puffy sleeves|puffy]] [[long sleeves]] with "[[clothes writing|NEMUSUGII]] [[number print|5]]" printed on the center and a [[pink choker|pink]] [[frilled choker]].

She has 3 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]]s with this costume:

* [[medium hair|Medium]]-to-[[long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[blonde hair]] tied into a [[one side up]] with a [[single hair ring]] held with a [[hair bow]] with a [[peach hair ornament]] and multiple [[hairclip]]s, including 2 [[heart hair ornament|heart-shaped]] ones and one with her name. 
* [[twin drills|Twin-drilled]] medium blonde hair with [[long sidelocks]] and [[blunt bangs]] tied into [[pink ribbon|two pink ribbons]] adorned with [[pink flower|pink]] [[hair flower|flowers]].
* Long [[messy hair|messy]] blonde hair with long sidelocks that fall over her [[hair over shoulder|shoulders]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6387298: Profile (without pom poms)
* !post #6387299: Profile (with pom poms)
* !post #6387297: L2D

title: momosuzu_nene_(new_year)
body:
The 3rd/New Years [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Momosuzu Nene]].

It consists of a [[black bowtie]], [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt]], an [[off shoulder|off-shoulder]] [[white kimono]] with a [[floral print|flower]] [[print kimono|print]], a [[brown capelet]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[blue hakama|hakama]] [[hakama skirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[lace legwear|lace]] socks and [[black footwear|black shoes]].

On March 31 2022, she got a Spring-themed version for this costume that with a [[official alternate costume|different color scheme]], with her hair bow now being teal-colored instead of blue, her bowtie now being [[red bowtie|red]] and her hakama is now [[pink hakama|pink]] instead of blue, her kimono also has a different pattern.

She has 3 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]]s with this costume:

* [[long hair|Long]] [[straight hair]] with [[sidelocks]]
* [[Short hair]] in a [[bob cut]] with [[blunt bangs]] and a [[hair flower]] and a [[hair bow]]
* [[Short hair with long locks]] with [[sidelocks]] that was introduced for the spring version

All, 3 hairstyles are decorated with a large [[hair flower]] and a [[hair bow]].

Since Nene originally didn't get her official New Year's costume alongside the rest of NePoLaBo for 2021 due to her character design being reworked at the time, there are some [[design speculation|fan interpretations]] based on some early design concepts showed by Nene during "one of her streams":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2dODcM458Bg].

h4. Appearance

* !post #5022219: Profile (New Year version)
* !asset #23328317: Profile (Spring version)
* !post #4302402: Example art inspired by early designs

title: captain_marvel
body:
An intergalactic peacekeeper typically associated with the Kree army. The title has been passed between several characters in the [[Marvel]] universe:

* [[Mar-Vell]] - the first Captain Marvel, deceased
* [[Monica Rambeau]] - the second Captain Marvel, becomes Photon and later Spectrum after conceding title
* Genis-Vell - the third Captain Marvel, became the second Photon, deceased
* Phylla-Vell - the fourth Captain Marvel, became Quasar and later Martyr, deceased
* Khn'nr - A Kree clone given Mar-Vell's memories and illness, deceased
* Noh-Varr - An alternate universe Kree soldier, became Protector and later Marvel Boy
* [[Carol Danvers]] - the fifth Captain Marvel (previously [[Ms. Marvel]]), currently holds the title

h4. See also

* [[Shazam]] - The original user of the name Captain Marvel 1939-2012
other_names: キャプテン・マーベル

title: jabberwock_(fate)
body:
Jabberwocky:

The Jabberwock
And as in uffish thought he stood,
The Jabberwock, with eyes of flame,
Came whiffling through the tulgey wood,
And burbled as it came!

One, two! One, two! And through and through,
The vorpal blade went snicker-snack!
He left it dead, and with its head,
He went galumphing back.

(Jabberwocky by Lewis Carrol)

[[Nursery_Rhyme_(Fate)|Nursery Rhyme]] can summon the Jabberwock (ジャバウォック, Jabawokku?), a being she calls a "friend" that is greater in power than Servants. It is initially believed to be the Berserker-class Servant of Alice, and it has an overwhelming presence. It uses a skill called Alice Eater (ありすイーター, Arisu Ītā?) to temporarily strengthen itself.
Its strength shakes the Arena itself, and simply nearing it allows for its fierce, swirling magical power to be felt. It can overwhelmingly defeat Hakuno Kishinami's Servant, and the only defense is to retreat because Alice doesn't have it to pursue them due to wishing to wait for Hakuno to "play" with her. It is created through their power, and it will stay until its granted magical energy is depleted. In the Fate/EXTRA Manga, it was shown that while Saber and Lancer could damage the Jabberwocky, it simply regenerated from its injuries, even restoring its decapitated head with no issue.

It can only be defeated by the Vorpal Blade, a "blade of legend that no one has ever seen", a Mystic Code weapon that has an effect on certain types of monstrosities. It is from the poem Jabberwocky by Lewis Carrol, depicting a nameless hero's quest to slay the fearsome beast. It is not something found normally within the Moon Cell, but crafted by an alchemist with Malachite. The one created by Rani VIII is only able to be used once. It emanates magic as it nears the Jabberwock, shrinking his aura and allowing for him to be defeated in regular combat.

https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Nursery_Rhyme_(Noble_Phantasm)

title: muscular_female
body:
A female character with visibly developed [[muscular|muscles]] that must have come from extensive training, body building or otherwise. 

[[Muscular female]] usually emphasize overall enlarged musculature, leaving the character looking thicker and more masculine without removing all traces of femininity. It's not just well developed [[abs]]. Look for thicker arms, legs, torsos, the whole deal.

Do not use together with the [[toned]] tag when describing one character.  If the character has an athletic build that’s not overly bulky, use [[toned]] instead.
Nor should it be used for female characters intentionally drawn to look like men (e.g. [[cho marisa]] with a beard, a Touhou girl drawn to look like Kenshiro).

title: izumi_izumi_(tokimeki_idol)
body:
Izumi_Izumi (伊澄いずみ) is a character in Tokimeki_Idol. She is a member of the unit Cookie Paradise.

Izumi is a game-loving girl who dreams of being a nationally-recognized game idol. She’s extremely into retro games and is particularly good at shooting games. She is trying to make a name for herself as an idol in order to ask for the production of a sequel to the "Gradius" series. She has a deep knowledge of analogue games as well as digital ones. Many of her family members and relatives work in the video game industry. She says that she is "Working as a video game idol to avoid the future of video games disappearing."

title: 2ch.ru
body:
[b]2ch.ru[/b], also referred as [b]Dvach[/b] (2007-2009) was the first, albeit short-lived [[Russian text|Russian]]-language imageboard. 

After the site's closure, it was cloned multiple times due to its popularity; the most notable and highest populated example is 2-ch.ru «[i]Tyrech[/i]» (2009-2014) which was changed into 2ch.hk «[i]Harkach[/i]» (2014 - present time).

Not to be confused with [[2channel]], an unrelated Japanese text board of similar origins.

h4. See also
* [[Dvach-tan]] - mascot

h4. External links
* Main page: http://2ch.hk
* Anime Art: http://2ch.hk/aa

title: tiger_ii
body:
A [[Germany|German]] heavy [[tank]] of [[World War II]]. The final official German designation was [b]Panzerkampfwagen Tiger Ausf. B[/b]. It is often referred to by the informal nickname "Royal Tiger" or "King Tiger", from the German "Königstiger". 

The Tiger II was the successor to the [[Tiger I]], combining the latter's thick armor with the armor sloping used on the [[Panther (tank)|]]. The tank weighed almost 70 metric tons, and was protected by 100 to 180 mm (3.9 to 7.1 in) of armor to the front. It was armed with the long barreled 8.8 cm KwK 43 L/71 gun. The chassis was also the basis for the [[Jagdtiger]] turretless [[tank destroyer]].

h4. See also
* [[Kurt Knispel]]
* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tiger II":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tiger_II
other_names: ケーニヒスティーガー

title: dfc-tan
body:
[[Original]] character belonging to an [[anonymous (4chan)|anonymous requester]] on [[4chan|4chan's]] /a/ board (Anime and Manga), featured in the [[drawfag]] threads. She is the [[personification|moe personification]] of the phrase "[b][[flat_chest|Delicious Flat Chest]][/b]," which is typically abbreviated as "[b]DFC[/b]."

* !post #8675619

Originally posted as an ordinary request, the original image, drawn by [[Ryotashi]], was posted in early [[2013]], gaining traction and notoriety among 4chan users and other niche anime communities. The character eventually became a minor [[meme]] and used as a common reaction image against large breast admirers.

Within a month of her popularity, her creator had another character created, [[DCT-tan]] ([b]Delicious Cow Tits[/b]), DFC's younger sister, an albino [[oppai loli]] [[polar opposites|foil]] who contrasted DFC-tan, specifically in regards to her chest size.

h4. See Also
* [[DCT-tan]]
* [[Drawfag]]
* [[Flat Chest]]

title: dct-tan
body:
[[Original]] character belonging to an [[anonymous (4chan)|anonymous requester]] from the [[Drawfag]] threads on [[4chan|4chan's]] /a/ board (Anime and Manga). She is the [[personification|moe personification]] of the phrase "[b][[large_breasts|Delicious Cow Tits]][/b]," being the younger sister and antithesis of [[DFC-tan]] ([b][[flat_chest|Delicious Flat Chest]][/b]), a character who became a minor [[meme]] on 4chan and other niche anime communities.

Because of the rise of notoriety of her older sister, DCT-tan was created as a foil against DFC-tan. Like with her older sister, her original art piece was drawn by [[Ryotashi]].

* !post #8675626

body:

A variant of the meme named "Live [[slug]] reaction", featuring [[Klaud (star wars)|]] from [[Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker]] later superseded the original, and is typically used when someone is not interested in the current topic they are "reacting" to.

title: tucker_carlson
body:
Tucker Carlson is a political commentator and former TV host on [[Fox News]]. Since 2016, he was the host of his own show on Fox News, [I]Tucker Carlson Tonight[/I], where he was criticize for promoting conservative and right wing views and spreading racist news, bigotry rhetoric and false conspiracy theories. Eventually he was fired in 2023 and his show cancelled, as the higher ups on Fox felt Carlson was doing more harm than good to the company with his views and the host became too full of himself.

He became a joke in 2024 when Carlson went to Russia to interview with Russian President [[Vladimir Putin]], where he was mocked for being an out of touch rich guy (since Tucker is a member of the Swanson Family, who help create the [[TV Dinner]]) on things he thought were impressive in Russia when they were very common in the US and Europe, and his interview with Putin was considered lackluster since both men were trying to force their political views on each other with no success.
other_names: タッカー・カールソン

title: paid_reward
body:
[b]Uploading paid rewards is not allowed[/b]. 
See forum #168930 for details.

A paid reward is a paywalled image from Patreon or any other similar site. Sites like these require that the user subscribe or pledge some amount of money every month to view and download these works. 
Alternatively, sites like Gumroad offer archived or other exclusive content, where this tag will also apply. 

Paid rewards include paid content from any of these sites:

* [[Patreon reward]]
* [[Enty reward]]
* [[Fantia reward]]
* [[Fanbox reward]]
* [[Gumroad reward]]

h4. Guidelines

Uploading paid rewards is against the rules. These are the rules for paid rewards:

* Public or free posts aren't paid rewards.
* If a post was free at the time of upload, then it's allowed.
* If an artist releases a paid reward for free later on, then it's allowed.
* Deliberately uploading paid rewards, even with this tag, will result in a warning then a ban.
* Paid rewards uploaded before 2020-07-06 are allowed.
* Paid rewards uploaded after 2020-07-06 should be reported in topic #10525 so they can be banned.
* [b]Be careful about uploading posts from Yande.re, E-Hentai, Kemono.su, or other sites that host unmarked paid rewards. Also be careful when uploading unmarked paid rewards hosted by potential art thieves.[/b]

h4. See also

* topic #11399
* topic #17033
* topic #17092
* forum #168930 
* [[paid reward available]]

title: mid-boss_(disgaea)
body:
Mid-Boss, real name Vyers, is a character that has first debuted in the [[Disgaea]] and made several cameo appearances in the later sequels. He obtained the nickname "Mid-Boss" from Laharl, who deemed him unworthy of his title of "The Dark Adonis" (which is self-proclaimed) and is the unofficial rival of Laharl.

He is very kind and good-natured, despite being a demon, possesses a French accent, and is very cocky in his abilities which results with him constantly challenging [[Laharl]], [[Etna (disgaea)|]], and [[Flonne]]. It is later revealed [spoiler]that Mid-Boss is actually King Krichevskoy, who is Laharl's father.[/spoiler]

title: howto:romanize
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* "Overview":[#dtext-intro]
* "Disclaimer":[#dtext-disclaim]
* "Guidelines":[#dtext-guide]
* "Examples":[#dtext-example]
* "Mistakes to avoid":[#dtext-miss]
* "Briefly on non-Japanese languages":[#dtext-other]
* "Return":[#dtext-return]
[/expand]

h4#intro. Overview

Danbooru generally tries to use the original names of artists, characters and titles, but for practical reasons, like Japanese being gobbledygook to most of our users, they have to be represented in the Latin alphabet. For this Danbooru has its own set of romanization rules based on the [b]revised[/b] Hepburn romanization scheme.

These rules are used both for tagging and for translations.

The system is used here because it has been deemed practical for the community's needs. The main goal is [b]consistency[/b]; secondarily, to give a good idea of the original (hiragana and katakana) spellings and pronunciations.

h4#disclaim. DISCLAIMER
h6. Should any official romanization exist, they take precedence over this standard.

* See forum #168056 for details.
* Changing such romanized tags to a more "correct" version would be counterproductive for search usage.

The main difference between [b]Wikipedia[/b] romanizations and Danbooru romanizations is that Wikipedia uses macrons for certain long vowels (e.g. [i]seiyū[/i]), while Danbooru uses the so-called waapuro style (e.g. [i]seiyuu[/i]; see below).

For non-Japanese romanizations, scroll to the bottom.

h4#guide. General Guidelines

The key points of the Danbooru romanization standard:

* For basic "gojuuon":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goj%C5%ABon]: [i]し→shi, ち→chi, つ→tsu, ふ→fu[/i].
* For basic "youon":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Y%C5%8Don]: [i]きゃ→kya, しゃ→sha, ちゃ→cha, にゃ→nya, ひゃ→hya, みゃ→mya, りゃ→rya[/i] (etc., symmetrically).
* For gojuuon with (han)dakuten: [i]ざ→za, じ→ji, ず→zu[/i] (etc.).
**  づ and ず both become [i]zu[/i], while ぢ and じ both become [i]ji[/i].
* For youon with (han)dakuten: [i]じゃ→ja[/i] (etc.).
* ん becomes [i]n[/i], unless followed by a vowel or a [i]y-[/i] sound, in which case it becomes [i]n'[/i]: [i]せんかん → senkan, にんい → nin'i, じゅんや → jun'ya[/i].
* Long vowels follow their hiragana spellings:  [i]えい→ei, おう→ou, おお→oo, とお→too, ゆう→yuu[/i] (etc.).
** "ー":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ch%C5%8Donpu is to be replaced by doubling the preceding vowel, e.g. [i]ハー→haa[/i].
* Gemination, marked with a "sokuon":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sokuon symbol (っ in hiragana and ッ in katakana), is shown by doubling the consonant: きっと → [i]kitto[/i], いっぱい → [i]ippai[/i], ほっかい → [i]hokkai[/i].
** If a consonant sound is represented by a digraph, only the first letter is doubled: エッチ → [i]ecchi[/i], いっしょ → [i]issho[/i], みっつ → [i]mittsu[/i].
* When used as a topical particle, は becomes [i]wa[/i]. When used as a lative particle, へ becomes [i]e[/i]. を remains [i]wo[/i] in all contexts.
* Japanese names are generally written in Japanese-style "Surname Given-name" order. For details, see "the passage on name order under tagging help":/help/tags.

For anything not covered by these rules, follow the "revised Hepburn romanization system":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hepburn_romanization.

These romanization rules have been worked out as the site grew, and there are still many tags that are not compliant with the guidelines. If you spot any poorly romanized tags, please post a message in the forum.

h4#example. Examples

* あずまんが大王 → あずまんがだいおう → Danbooru: [i]Azumanga Daiou[/i], [b]Official: [[Azumanga Daioh]][/b].
* イリヤスフィール・フォン・アインツベルン → [[Illyasviel von Einzbern]].  [b]For non-Japanese or outright made-up proper names, use their official spellings where possible.[/b]
* 幻想郷 → げんそうきょう → [[Gensokyo]].
* 天王 はるか → てんおう はるか → [[Ten'ou Haruka]].  (The apostrophe is needed here to distinguish てんおう from てのう.)
* 遠坂 凛 → とおさか りん → Danbooru: [i]Toosaka Rin[/i], [b]Official: [[Tohsaka Rin]][/b].
* 葉月 → はづき → "Hazuki":/users/615.
* 魔法少女リリカルなのは → まほうしょうじょリリカルなのは → [[Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha]]. [b]For foreign words like[/b] [i]lyrical[/i], [b]follow the spellings of their respective source languages.[/b]
** ランドセル → [[randoseru]]. As an exception to the above, [b]loanwords whose semantics have changed in the borrowing process are often romanized as if they were Japanese.[/b]

h4#miss. Mistakes to avoid

* [i]とおの → toono[/i], [b]not[/b] [i]*tono, *tōno, *tohno[/i] or [i]*touno[/i].  Watch out for style differences like this when referencing other sources, [b]unless the official romanization says [i]tohno[/i][/b].
* [i]ゆうか → yuuka[/i], [b]not[/b] [i]*yuka[/i] or [i]*yūka[/i].  Long vowels again, [b]unless the official romanization says [i]yuka[/i][/b].

h4#other. Briefly on non-Japanese languages

For other languages, the same guidelines and principles mentioned apply, focusing on official/standard/common romanizations first, due to recognizability, and consistency second.

For Chinese, "pinyin":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pinyin] is the preferred means of romanization. However, diacritic marks are not used in tags, so they must be dropped (e.g. using [[Beijing]], if rendered in pinyin with its diacritics, it would be [i]Běijīng[/i]). If any further information is required on the given Chinese characters present, utilize a resource such as "Wiktionary":[https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E9%AC%BC] or the "Chinese Text Project":[https://ctext.org/dictionary.pl?if=en&char=%E9%AC%BC].

For Korean, the "Revised Romanization":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Revised_Romanization_of_Korean] used in South Korea is the preferred means of romanization. For Korean names, unless a specific romanized spelling is provided, utilize the most common spelling as used by resources such as Wikipedia.

For Cyrillic, user discretion is advised, as romanization standards vary across the various languages which make use of Cyrillic. As such, focus on identifying the language rather than relying on the script itself. The most common means of romanization for each Cyrillic-using language is preferred, which can be found on Wikipedia.

In several languages which utilize the Latin alphabet, in contrast to English, there is regular use of diacritics (e.g. German). While in some languages there are standardized means of transcribing these diacritics as to retain the word's original spelling (e.g. Ä as Ae), in others there are not, and will involve dropping the diacritics to render their words in an environment where they cannot be accessed. User discretion is advised on how to handle diacritics at a given moment.

h4#return. Go Back

* "Return to Notes and Translations":[/help/toc#dtext-notes_and_translations]
* "Return to the Table of Contents":[/help/toc]
* "Return to the Wiki Help Home Page":[/help/home]

title: sakamata_chloe_(jirai_kei)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] for [[hololive]]'s [[Sakamata Chloe]]. It has a [[jirai kei]] theme.

It consists of a [[two-sided coat|two-sided]] [[red coat|red]] and [[black coat]] with [[lace-trimmed sleeves]], a [[black dress|black]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[see-through dress|see-through]] [[frilled dress]] with a [[heart cutout|heart-shaped]] [[cleavage cutout]] and a [[black bowtie]] with a [[heart-shaped lock]]; with a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[grey shirt|grey]] [[frilled shirt]] with [[center frills]] and a [[black_skirt|black]] [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[miniskirt]]-length [[overskirt]] over it, an [[heart o-ring|heart]] [[o-ring thigh strap]] [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]] [[black thighhighs|black]] and [[fishnet thighhighs|fishnet]] [[fishnet thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black shoes]] [[platform footwear|platform]] [[loafers]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has her [[medium hair]] hair tied into [[side braids]] that turn into [[braided hair rings]] and [[twin drills|drill]] [[twintails]], decorated with a [[bandaid hair ornament]], [[x hair ornament|crossing]] [[hairclip]]s and [[black ribbon]] [[hair ribbon]]s.

h4. Appearance

title: saroi_fujimo_(gal_gun)
body:
Saori Fujimo is a straight-laced English teacher who's strict for the sake of her students.

Strict, yet kind and considerate. Popular with the delinquent crowd. Secretly worried she needs to find a husband before it's too late.

She was classmates with Kuribayashi Rena, but they never agree on anything.

title: sena_izumi_(ensemble_stars!)
body:
[i][[Ensemble Stars!]][/i] character. A third year student and member of [[knights (ensemble stars!)|Knights]]. He was the substitute leader for a while until the return of [[tsukinaga leo|Leo Tsukinaga]].

He has [[short hair|short]] [[silver hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. At school, he wears the standard [[yumenosaki school uniform|Yumenosaki uniform]], consisting on [[plaid pants]], a [[blazer]] with a [[vest]] and [[necktie]]. For Knights, he wears [[black gloves]], [[striped pants]] and a [[white shirt]] with [[epaulettes]].

Foul-mouthed and not honest with himself, Izumi has a big attitude, is full of confidence, and assumes a detached attitude towards the world at large. He used to be a popular model, but went on hiatus and entered the school in order to start over as an idol. He's fond of fellow former model [[yuuki makoto (ensemble stars!)|Makoto Yuuki]] but dismissive of anyone else.

Izumi initially considers [[anzu (ensemble stars!)|Anzu]] an amateur producer and a rival in his affections for Makoto. In later stories however, he learns Anzu and Makoto's relationship is nothing to worry about and begins recognizing her skills as a producer.

title: you_should_kill_yourself_now_(meme)
body:
A notorious [[meme]] based off of infamous FGC streamer [[Low Tier God]], in which he has particular enunciation of the tag's phrase, directed at an alleged stream sniper.

Over time, this would go on to spawn photoshopped versions of LTG, with [[glowing eyes]], channeling [[lightning]], and the tag's phrase being included in the picture, with "NOW!" being noticeably larger than the rest of the phrase. To circumvent automatic censorship algorithms, the phrase is sometimes omitted with only the photo, glowing eyes and lightning hinting at the suicide baiting.

* !asset #23117095

h4.External links
* "Know Your Meme: You Should Kill Yourself... Now!":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/you-should-kill-yourself-now

title: new_year
body:
An image relating to the first day of the new year on the Gregorian calendar.

It's a tradition for many Japanese artists to celebrate the new year by drawing girls clad in expensive [[kimono]], eating [[zouni soup]], carrying [[hamaya]] (a [[Shinto]] ward against evil and bad luck) and playing [[hanetsuki]]. 

Many artists also pay tribute to the [[Chinese zodiac]] by incorporating whatever animal corresponds to the year. It should be noted that the Chinese new year is not on January 1 of the Gregorian calendar, but instead varies from one year to the next (falling in either late January or early February). The year of the horse, for example, begins January 31, 2014. Despite this, images utilizing the animal of an upcoming Chinese New Year tend to begin appearing around January 1, as Japan uses the same zodiac but does not use the Chinese Lunar calendar. 

The typical way of telling if an image is celebrating the New Year is by the phrase 謹賀新年 ([i]kinga shinnen[/i], literally "happy new year") or by one or both of the more traditional greeting exchanges (shortened as [[akeome]] and [[kotoyoro]]). It is also common for New Year images to include [[Happy New Year]] in English text, and/or the number of the year. Text indicating a new year related image may also be absent from the image itself but present in Pixiv tags/artist commentary, website text, etc. 

h4. List of Chinese zodiac years

* [[year of the rat]]
* [[year of the ox]]
* [[year of the tiger]]
* [[year of the rabbit]]
* [[year of the dragon]]
* [[year of the snake]]
* [[year of the horse]]
* [[year of the goat]]
* [[year of the monkey]]
* [[year of the rooster]]
* [[year of the dog]]
* [[year of the pig]]

h4. See also 

* [[akeome]] (New Year's greeting)
* [[kotoyoro]] (New Year's greeting)
* [[nengajou]] (Japanese New Year cards)
* [[kadomatsu]] (bamboo New Year's decoration)
* [[shimekazari]] (knitted rice straw rope)
* [[hanetsuki]] (badminton-like New Year's game)
* [[hatsumoude]] (first shrine visit of the New Year)
* [[hatsuyume]] (first dream of the New Year)
* [[happy new year]]
* [[kagami mochi]] (traditional New Year's dessert)
* [[otoshidama]] (gift of money given to children)
* [[ema]] (wooden prayer/wish board)
* [[omikuji]] (Shinto fortune slips)
* [[omamori]] (pouch-shaped amulets sold at shrines)
* [[chinese new year]] 
* [[tag group:holidays and celebrations]] 
* [[tag group:year tags]]

title: shameimaru_aya
body:
The "Traditional Reporter of Fantasy". First appeared as an opponent (and later, playable character) in the ninth [[Touhou]] game, [i][[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]][/i]. She has since reappeared in other games as a playable character, and often appears in the various print works.

Aya is a crow tengu, and has the ability to manipulate the wind in addition to the exceptional sight and long-range hearing possessed by most tengu. She is also absurdly fast, perhaps even the fastest in Gensokyo. She runs, reports, and photographs for her own newspaper, the [i][[Bunbunmaru]] Shinbun[/i]. However, the publication is notorious for being filled with rumors, gossip, and personal opinion. 

She is the rival of fellow journalist [[Himekaidou Hatate]], who runs the [i]Kakashi Nenpo[/i] ("Kakashi Spirit Times"). She was (and still is) also often depicted in fanworks as a friend to (or the superior of) the white wolf tengu [[Inubashiri Momiji]], one of the guardians of Youkai Mountain. However, it was revealed in [[Double Spoiler]] that the two actually dislike one another. 

Her catchphrase is "[[ayaya~]]".

h4. Appearance 
Aya has [[red eyes]] and [[black hair]] of varying lengths. Her outfits have changed somewhat throughout her various appearances, but by far her most common outfit is a small [[red hat|red]] [[tokin hat]] with two strings of [[pom_pom_(clothes)|pom poms]] attached, a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with a [[black ribbon]] tied around the collar, [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[black skirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs|knee-high socks]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[tengu-geta]]. She often carries around an old [[camera]], a [[notebook]] and [[calligraphy brush]], and a [[hauchiwa]] (a leaf-shaped fan).

Due to variations in depiction, she may also have [[pointy ears]] or long, [[black wings|black]] [[bird wings|feathered wings]]. Her outfit may also sport an [[armband]] or a tan, [[leaf print|leaf-patterned stripe]] motif. Other times, she may be shown wearing a completely different outfit, such as the [[Kourindou Tengu costume]] from [[Curiosities of Lotus Asia|CoLA]] or her combination of a [[cabbie hat]], [[necktie|tie]], and [[suit jacket]] from [[Forbidden Scrollery]] which should be tagged as [[Shameimaru Aya (newsboy)]].

h4. See also

* [[ayaya~]]
* [[kimeemaru]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Aya Shameimaru":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Aya_Shameimaru

title: holomyth_anniversary_outfit
body:
An [[official alternate costume]] for [[holoMyth]]'s second anniversary designed by [[Harimoji]]

This tag is for the outfit worn by holoMyth during their second anniversary. Don't use it for [[hololive English]] members wearing the standard [[Hololive idol uniform (origin)|]].

It consist of a color-coded [[tilted headwear|tilted]] [[mini top hat]], a [[strapless]] [[black bustier|black]] [[bustier]], color-coded [[wrist cuffs]], a color-coded [[layered skirt|layered]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[white bow|white]] [[bow skirt|bow]] on the back and color coded [[pumps]], there are 3 variations of the top of the outfit:

title: quake_1
body:
[i]For the disaster, see [[earthquake]][/i].

A first person shooter that was released by [[id Software]] in 1996 for the Pc and the first [[video game]] in the popular Quake series of video games. It is considered the first true 3D FPS game, unlike [[doom (series)|DooM]], which was actually 2.5D.

In the game, players must find their way out of various maze-like, medieval environments while battling a variety of monsters using a wide array of guns. The game's monsters were inspired by the creatures from [[h_p_lovecraft|H.P. Lovecraft]]'s [[Cthulhu Mythos]]. 

The successor to id's [[doom (series)|Doom]] series, Quake built upon the technology and gameplay of its predecessor in many ways. Unlike the Doom engine before it, the Quake engine offered full real-time 3D rendering and early support for 3D acceleration through OpenGL. 

Quake was programmed by John Carmack, Michael Abrash and John Cash. The level and scenarios were designed by American McGee, Sandy Petersen, John Romero and Tim Willits. The graphics were designed by Adrian Carmack, and Kevin Cloud. Music and sound design was by Trent Reznor, founder of [[Nine Inch Nails]]. The game engine developed for Quake, the "Quake engine", popularized several major advances in the 3D game genre: polygonal models instead of prerendered sprites; full 3D level design instead of a 2.5D map; prerendered lightmaps; and allowing end users to partially program the game (in this case with QuakeC), which popularized fan-created modifications or "mods".

After DooM helped popularize multiplayer deathmatches, Quake added various multiplayer options. Various multiplayer mods were developed including Team Fortress and Capture The Flag.

The game received much acclaim on release and its commercial success led to several sequels, starting with [[Quake 2]], which abandoned the gothic stylings of the original for a [[science fiction]] theme. Because of this, Quake has since been recognized as one of the greatest achievements of the video game industry, influencing games that came after it, as well as the artforms of user mods and machinima.

h4.See also

* [[Shambler]]
* [[Shambler-Chan]]
* [[Chthon]]

title: hinanawi_tenshi
body:
The "Girl of the Highest Heaven". Final boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Scarlet Weather Rhapsody]][/i] and later a recurring playable character. A spoiled formerly-human celestial with the ability to manipulate land and weather, motivated by boredom to cause chaos. The official profile states that she was called Chiko (地子) at the time when she was human, and thus used to refer to her younger-self in fanworks.

She carries a weapon called the [[Sword of Hisou]], a tool which can be only used by celestials. She is frequently seen with her [[kaname-ishi]]s, a kind of [[floating rock]] with a [[shimenawa]] and [[shide]].

Her notable nickname is "Tenko" (てんこ; an alternate reading of her name). Many fans portray her as a [[masochism|masochist]], based on her dialogue in SWR demanding "punishment for her deeds", often landing her on the receiving end of other girls' wrath, especially the [[sadism|sadistic]] [[Kazami Yuuka]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] and [[red eyes]] and usually [[flat chest|doesn't have a large chest]]. Her [[hat]] is [[black hat|black]] with a [[peach hat ornament|peach]] and a [[leaf hat ornament|leaf]] on it. She wears a [[buttons|buttoned]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] with [[center frills]] and [[puffy short sleeves]] and a [[red bowtie]] with a [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[blue skirt]]. Sometimes she is drawn with a [[frilled apron|frilled]] [[white apron|white]] [[waist apron]] decorated with a [[rainbow gradient]] rope, and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[cross-laced footwear|cross-laced]] [[boots]].

h4. External Links
* "Touhou Wiki":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Tenshi_Hinanai

title: twisted_metal
body:
Twisted Metal is a series of vehicular combat video games published by Sony Computer Entertainment, and developed by various companies for the PlayStation, PlayStation 2, PlayStation Portable and PlayStation 3. 

The games follow Calypso, the mysterious host of a deadly vehicular combat tournament called "Twisted Metal", with the promise of granting the winner whatever they ask for if they win the tournament.

A live action television adaptation staring Anthony Mackie aired on Peacock in 2023. Unlike the video games, the tv show is a post-apocalyptic dark comedy which features characters from the games. Despite being different from it's source, the show was a surprise hit with a second season in the works.

title: cinderella_(nikke)
body:
A character from [[Goddess of Victory: NIKKE]]. She is a member of the [[Old Tales (Nikke)|]] squad, the second generation of Grimms models, along with [[Red Shoes (nikke)|]], [[Little Mermaid (nikke)|]], [[Hansel (nikke)|]] and [[Gretel (nikke)|]].


Formerly known as [b]Anachiro[/b], she was created by [[Abe (nikke)|]] and was supposed to assist the [[Goddess (nikke)|Goddess Squad]] in an operation to kill the Rapture Queen. [spoiler]She was eventually corrupted by her friend, Red Shoes who wanted to use her as a gateway in achieving unity with the Raptures. This results in humanity officially declaring their defeat against the Raptures and the subsequent retreatment to the Ark, an underground city.[/spoiler]

[[Liliweiss (nikke)|]] said that Cinderella uses Blitzkrieg tactics: employing overwhelming force to achieve victory as quickly as possible. Due to this, Cinderella is believed to exceed the strengths and abilities of each individual Goddess member.

Like her predecessors and her squad, her name and by extension, her weaponry, is named after the "folk tale of the same name":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cinderella].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] tied in [[twintails]] and [[large breasts]]. She originally had [[blue eyes]], but now currently has [[red eyes]] at post-corruption. Her outfit consists of a [[backless outfit|backless]] [[white leotard]] with [[turtleneck]] and [[clothing cutout|cutout]] around her [[cleavage cutout|cleavage]] and [[armpit cutout|armpits]] which extends down to her legs.

Illustrator: [[Yoya Yogurt]]
Voice actress: [[Yuuki Aoi]]

title: edge_(wrestler)
body:
Canadian professional wrestler and a [[WWE]] Hall of Famer, currently working for [[All Elite Wrestling]] under the name [b]Cope[/b].

Real name: [b]Adam Joseph Copeland[/b]

h4. Known moves

* Spear
* [I]Grindhouse[/I] - [[Crippler Crossface]], sometimes combined with a [[sleeper hold]].
** [I]Glasgow Grin[/I] - An illegal variant where a broken metal rod from a [[folding chair]] is used for leverage.
* [I]Con-chair-to[/I] - A tag team, double [[folding chair]] sandwiching attack to an opponent's head. 
** [I]One Man Con-chair-to[/I] - A single version, where the prone opponent's head is placed onto a closed folding chair and then the user of this move delivers a chair shot onto the former's head, mimicking the sandwiching part of the original, tag team version.

title: suburb
body:
Suburbs can be found on the outskirts of cities, serving as an intermediary between urban and rural zones, and are characterized by rows of one- to two-story [[house]]s. Suburb has a broad application in real life, but for Danbooru purposes it should describe multiple individual homes.

h4. Examples
* !post #8145667
* !post #8639003

h4. See also
* [[rural]]
* [[urban]]

title: city
body:
A relatively large and permanent settlement. Cities generally have complex systems for sanitation, utilities, land usage, housing, and transportation. The concentration of development greatly facilitates interaction between people and businesses, benefiting both parties in the process. A big city or metropolis usually has associated suburbs and exurbs. Such cities are usually associated with metropolitan areas and urban areas, creating numerous business commuters traveling to urban centers for employment. Once a city expands far enough to reach another city, this region can be deemed a conurbation or megalopolis.

title: crying_wojak
body:
A variant of [[Wojak]] featuring the character [[crying with eyes open]] out of frustration. Typically used interchangeably with [[Soyjak]]s to depict the stereotypical hardcore fandoms/group when they seems to cannot counter an argument.

A popular version of this variant feature the crying Wojak wearing a [[mask]] of their [[smug]] face. This is used to point out someone who still maintains apparent façade of superiority even when they are losing the argument.

title: wojak
body:
A macro [[meme]] first appeared around 2010 as a part of the "rage comics" series of memes. Originally used to display wearyness/content mood.

Wojak saw a huge revival around 2020 as a template for various macro memes and spawned several derivatives, either as a depiction of a stereotypical types of internet users or simply as a reaction images.

H4. Wojaks
* !asset #23313780: A generic wojak

The name is taken from the Polish word "wojak", meaning "soldier" or "fighter".

h4. Variations
* [[Coomer (meme)|]]
* [[Crying Wojak]]
* [[Doomer]]
* [[Doomer girl]]
* [[E-thot]]
* [[Soyjak]]
* [[Tradwife]]

* [[Two Soyjaks pointing (meme)|]]

title: nakagawa_nana
body:
[[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]'s [[Yuki Setsuna]]'s real identity, used to refer to her everyday self outside of being a school idol. Use this tag whenever Setsuna is portrayed as her student persona or when she's depicted with elements from it (i.e. wearing glasses or with braids instead of her half updo hairslyle). If both personas are present, [[dual persona]] may apply.

She has [[black eyes|black]] or [[grey eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and [[low twin braids]]. She wears [[red-framed eyewear|red]] [[under-rim eyewear|under-rim]] [[glasses]] and is usually depicted wearing the [[Nijigasaki School Uniform]]. While serving as the student council president, she wears a [[red armband|red]] [[armband]]. At home, she sports a [[low twintails]] hairstyle.

title: nanatsu_no_taizai
body:
[b]Nanatsu no Taizai[/b] (七つの大罪, lit. [i]The Seven Deadly Sins[/i]) is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by [[Suzuki Nakaba]]. It has been serialized in [[Kodansha]]'s Weekly Shounen Magazine since October 2012. The manga features a setting similar to the European Middle Ages, with its titular group of knights representing the seven deadly sins. The series was continued with the next-generation manga [i][[Mokushiroku no Yonkishi]][/i].

Not to be confused with the [[The Seven Deadly Sins]], another series by the same name.

h4. Characters

h6. Main Characters a.k.a. The Seven Sins

title: cosplay
body:
[b]Cosplay[/b] [i](short for "costume play")[/i] refers to real people dressing up as fictional characters. This is somewhat similar to [[halloween_costume|Halloween costumes]] (and they can certainly overlap), but a good cosplay outfit is often far more elaborate.

This tag is also used to refer to fictional characters who are dressed as other characters from the same or another anime/manga/game/etc.

[[photo (medium)|Photos]] should only be tagged with the character being cosplayed and [[cosplay photo]]. In the case of anime characters cosplaying other characters, add a [b][i]xxx[/i]_(cosplay)[/b] tag. For example, if you have a drawing of [[remilia scarlet|Remilia]] cosplaying as [[hakurei reimu|Reimu]], you should use the following tags:

* [[remilia_scarlet]]
* [[hakurei_reimu_(cosplay)]]
* [[hakurei_reimu]]
* [[cosplay]]

Adding the tag [[hakurei_reimu_(cosplay)]] will automatically add the tags [[hakurei_reimu]] and [[cosplay]] for you (see [[help:autotags]]).

[b]Note:[/b] Besides adding the cosplay tags, be sure to also tag the associated copyrights that go along with the character being cosplayed.

h4. See also

* [[borrowed clothes]]
* [[borrowed hairstyle]]
* [[Ohno Kanako]] ([i][[Genshiken]][/i])
* [[Tag group:Artistic license]]

title: shin_getter_robo
body:
The fourth manga released in the [[Getter Robo]] Saga, Shin Getter Robo (otherwise known as Change Getter Robo) is an interquel that takes place between [[Getter Robo G]] and [[Getter Robo Go]]. Ran from 1996 to 1999.

The series was loosely adapted into an OVA in 1998, titled [b]Shin!! Getter Robo: Sekai Saigo no Hi[/b] (known as [b]Getter Robo Armageddon[/b] in English). The adaptation also incorporates elements of other installments in the Getter Saga, as well as elements from some of Ishikawa Ken's non-Getter works.

The titular mecha also appears prominently in [[Shin Getter Robo vs Neo Getter Robo]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Shin Getter Robo":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Getter_Robo#Shin_Getter_Robo]

title: emperor_(arknights)
body:
A non-playable character in [[Arknights]], one of the [i]Beast Lords[/i].

He is an [[emperor penguin|emperor]] [[penguin]] who appears to be minimally anthropomorphic. Despite this, he can talk, as well as "hold and fire a handgun":[/posts/3842621] (though his preferred sidearm is fake and only fires rubber bullets.)

He typically wears a white [[beanie]], [[sunglasses]], multiple [[gold necklace]]s, and a T-shirt depicting [[Tupac Shakur]]—spelled "Topac" on the shirt and in the game script, presumably to avoid legal issues.

Judging by his coloration and build, he is in fact a king penguin, not an emperor penguin.

He is both a world-famous rapper and hip-hop producer known as "the rap god of Columbia", and the CEO and founder of [[Penguin Logistics (Arknights)|Penguin Logistics]]. He is also frequently depicted alongside [[Magallan (Arknights)|Magallan]] in fanart due to her penguin motif and the in-game lore revealing that the two are good friends.

The Emperor is voiced by [[Tsuda Kenjirou]], while his English singing voice is done by American rapper Substantial.

title: lowlight_kirilenko
body: Chinese artist. An early art director/lead design at [[yu_zhong|MICA Team]], contributing to the early stages of [[Girls' Frontline]] (illustrating 4 out of the 5 members of the AR Team), before amicably departing over creative differences (shortly after Arctic Warfare) to become one of the founding members of Hypergryph, the company that created [[Arknights]]. He is now the producer of [[Arknights]] and [[Arknights: Endfield]].

title: amy_(huffslove)
body: Amy is an original character created by artist [[huffslove]] for the Tome of Imps series. Originally a human scholar, she was sent the Tome of Imps by her friend [[diana_(huffslove)|Diana]] at the conclusion of "Diana's own experiences with the Tome":[/pools/24453]. After initially berating Diana for recklessly using lewd magical items, she too eventually eventually becomes one of many imps inhabiting the Tome, appearing in later comics and 1-shots. It is suggested that much of her 'research material' might actually be smut, lewd toys, etc.

title: diana_(huffslove)
body: Diana is an original character created by artist [[huffslove]] for the Tome of Imps series. Originally a human adventurer, she discovered the Tome of Imps in a dungeon during "the first comic to feature her":[/pools/24453], and was slowly turned into an imp as well due to the magical influence of the book. She's now just one of many imps inhabiting the Tome, and appears in other comics and 1-shots as well. She was a good friend of [[amy_(huffslove)|Amy]] before her adventure, and mailed the Tome to her after turning into an imp.

title: black_panther_(marvel)
body:
In the [[marvel|Marvel Universe]], the title of Black Panther is a generations-old mantle carried by the ruler of the highly advanced African nation of Wakanda. 

In media, said title is often held by King [[T'Challa]], son of King T'Chaka.

Characters wearing the iconic Black Panther [[superhero costume|suit]] qualify for use of this tag, otherwise, T'Challa should be included as a parent tag if necessary.

title: omegon
body: One of the [[primarch|"Twin Primarchs"]] that [[alpharius_omegon|Alpharius Omegon]] was split into. [[Alpharius]] was more publicly known while [[Omegon]] was kept initially in the shadows as a hidden "Double [[Primarch]]". They are the genesires of the 20th [[adeptus_astartes|Legiones Astartes]],  the [[alpha_legion|Alpha Legion]].

title: alpharius_omegon
body:
[[Warhammer 40K]] character. [[Primarch]](s) of the [[Alpha Legion]].

"Twin" primarch who were split in two, known as either Alpharius Omegon as one individual, or Alpharius and Omegon as two separate individuals.

h6. Wargear and other commonly used tags: 
(Text taken from https://wh40k.lexicanum.com. Tags added.)

[quote]Typical of the Alpha Legion's nature, Alpharius and Omegon utilized completely non-standard and inconsistent wargear and even the Primarch himself did not typically engage in open combat. He often preferred using Cameleoline-lined cloaks and armour that partially cloaked the wearer. However, Alpharius and Omegon were observed utilizing reptilian-style [[Power_armor|Power_Armour]] known as [[The_Pythian_Scales]].[7] One of his stranger reported weapons was the Xenos artifact known as [[the_Pale_Spear_(warhammer)|the_Pale_Spear]], and a Plasma Weapon known as The Hydra's Spite. Alpharius Omegon was also seen with Power [[Holding_sword|Sword]]s, Power [[Holding_polearm|Spears]], and Plasma [[Holding_gun|Guns]] in combat situations.[3]

Omegon possesses a suit of [[grey_armor|grey]] power armour that he keeps hidden from everyone, including his brother Alpharius.[9] Though if one takes into consideration Alpharius' dubious tale of being the first rediscovered Primarch, this suit may have belonged to him instead of the later-discovered Omegon.[17f]   [/quote]
other_names: アルファリウス=オメゴン

[[Warhammer 40K]] character. [[Primarch]] of the [[White Scars]].

(Text taken from https://wh40k.lexicanum.com. Tags added.)

title: perturabo
body:
[[Warhammer 40K]] character. [[Primarch]] of the IVth [[adeptus_astartes|Legiones Astartes]], the [[Iron Warriors]].

h6. Wargear and other commonly used tags: 
(Text taken from https://wh40k.lexicanum.com. Tags added.)

[quote]Perturabo's primary weapon during the Heresy was the [[thunder_hammer|Thunder Hammer]] [[Forgebreaker]], a weapon that had previously belonged to [[ferrus_manus|Ferrus Manus]] before being given to him as a gift by [[fulgrim|Fulgrim]].[7] For protection, Perturabo wore a highly modified suit of Cataphractii Pattern [[terminator_armor|Terminator Armour]] known as [[The Logos]]. One of the most advanced suits of its age, it was equipped with a wide variety of support systems as well as a Teleport beacon. The Logos was also equipped with a pair of four-barreled wrist-mounted cannons.[9] On the battlefield, Perturabo would sometimes ride a modified Shadowsword known as Tormentor. [/quote]

    After the Horus Heresy, the Daemon Prince Lorgar is seen wielding an intricate metal rod topped with a 3-eyed skull.[14] [/quote]

title: leman_russ
body:
[[Warhammer 40K]] character. [[Primarch]] of the [[Space Wolves]].

h6. Wargear and other commonly used tags: 
(Text taken from https://wh40k.lexicanum.com. Tags added.)

[quote]Leman Russ's primary weapon during the Horus Heresy was the Frostblade [[Mjalnar]], an ancient weapon also known as the Sword of Balenight. Prior to taking up Mjalnar he wielded the [[chainsword]] [[Krakenmaw]] until it was destroyed by Angron during the Night of the Wolf. To complement his sword, Russ also wielded the frost [[battle_axe|axe]] [[Helwinter]].[22] For longer-ranged engagements, Russ wielded the [[combi-bolter|bolter]] [[Scornspitter]]. Russ is also known to have had an artifact known as the [[Spear_of_Russ]], but he hated the weapon and ultimately gave it to Bjorn during the Battle of Yarant.[21]

For protection, Russ wore a singular suit of artificer [[power_armor|armour]] known as [[the Armour Elavagar]].[23][/quote]

title: corvus_corax_(warhammer)
body:
[[Warhammer 40K]] character. [[Primarch]] of the [[Raven Guard]].

h6. Wargear and other commonly used tags: 
(Text taken from https://wh40k.lexicanum.com. Tags added.)

[quote]In battle, Corax favoured a Heavy [[Bolter]] for long-range killing, which he hefted and aimed as easily as an ordinary man would lift a battle rifle. He wielded two Archeotech [[pistol]]s as additional firepower. For close quarters fighting he carried a three-headed Power [[Whip]] specially crafted for him by the [[adeptus_mechanicus|Adeptus Mechanicus]] as well as a pair of [[lightning_claws|Lightning Claws]] known as [[the_Raven's_Talons_(warhammer)|The Raven's Talons]]. In the absence of these weapons, he was more than able to tear apart enemies with his bare hands.[6] Corax wore a jet-black suit of [[Power_Armor|Power Armour]] known as [[The_Sable_Armor|The Sable Armour]] which incorporated an advanced Jump Pack known as the [[Korvidine Pinions]]. The Sable Armour was also capable of masking his energy signature and could be used to jam nearby enemy communications.[7]

Corax's most potent ability, however, was his "wraith-slip", also called a Shadow-Slip or Shadow-Walk. This allowed him to seemingly meld with the shadows around him, disappearing from the view of his foes before striking unseen.[8] Following his reappearance sometime after the Heresy, Corax became empowered by the Warp itself. Able to contend with the Daemon Primarch [[lorgar_aurelian|Lorgar]], Corax is now capable of transforming himself into shadows, darkness, and unkindnesses of ravens.[13]  [/quote]

Misc. appearance tags: [[black_armor]], [[black_hair]], [[animal_skull]], [[animal_skull_ornament]], [[bird_skull]], [[long_hair]], [[power_armor]], [[the_sable_armor]]
other_names: コルウス・コラックス

title: angron
body:
[[Warhammer 40K]] character. [[Primarch]] of the [[World Eaters]].

h6. Wargear and other commonly used tags: 
(Text taken from https://wh40k.lexicanum.com. Tags added.)

[quote]During the Great Crusade and Horus Heresy, Angron wielded the twin [[Chain_Axe]]s [[Gorechild]] and [[Gorefather]]. Before these twin weapons, he wielded the primitive Chainaxe [[Widowmaker_weapon|Widowmaker]], which was broken in battle against Leman Russ during the Night of the Wolf. To replace it, Angron took up the massive [[battle_axe|axe]] [[Brazentooth]], which was eventually given to the Word Bearers as a sign of their alliance.[17] For protection, Angron wore a massive suit of Power Armour designed from his Nucerian [[gladiator|gladiatorial]] armor known as [[the_Armour_of_Mars|the Armor of Mars]]. Angron also wielded the Plasma [[Pistol]] [[Spite_Furnace|Spite Furnace]].[16] Upon becoming a Daemon Prince, Angron abandoned most of his mortal weaponry, taking up the Daemon Weapon known as the [[Black_Blade_(warhammer)|Black Blade]].

Since his recent return to the Materium, Angron has taken up the Daemon Weapon [[Samni'arius]] and [[Chain_Axe]] [[Spinegrinder]].[30]  [/quote]

title: konrad_curze
body:
[[Warhammer 40K]] character. [[Primarch]] of the [[Night Lords]].

Curze's primary weapons were twin [[clawed gauntlets|Lightning Claws]] known as Mercy and Forgiveness. For protection, Curze wore a terrifying suit of [[Power Armor]] known as  the Nightmare Mantle, which was decorated with the flayed skin and body parts of his victims. In combat, he was also known to have wielded a Flaying Knife-shaped Power Sword and throwing knives known as Widowmakers.

title: fulgrim
body:
[[Warhammer 40K]] character. [[Primarch]] of the [[Emperor's Children]].

h6. Wargear and other commonly used tags: 
(Text taken from https://wh40k.lexicanum.com. Tags added.)
[quote]Fulgrim wielded many weapons throughout the Heresy. He is perhaps most famous for the [[the_laer_blade|Silver Blade of Laer]], the daemonic weapon that drove him to corruption. However, before wielding this weapon, his primary weapon was [[The_fireblade_(warhammer)|Fireblade]], a power sword built for him by [[Ferrus Manus]]. After the Battle of Isstvan III, Fulgrim also came into the possession of the Anathame. During the Drop Site Massacre, Fulgrim effectively wielded Manus's thunderhammer [[Forgebreaker]] for a time. Fulgrim's personal firearm was the volkite charger Firebrand, while his power armour was an ornate artistically-crafted suit known as [[the Gilded Panoply]].

After becoming a Daemon Prince, Fulgrim wielded a wide series of daemonic blades and spears collectively referred to as the Blades of the Phoenician[/quote]

title: roboute_guilliman
body:
A [[Warhammer 40K]] character who is the [[Primarch]] of the XIIIth [[adeptus_astartes|Legiones Astartes]], the [[Ultramarines]]. A master strategist and administrative figure, his Legion was one of the largest to the lead up of the Horus Heresy. In recent lore, he was awoken from stasis within the Ultramarines' Fortress-Monastary and has become the [i]de facto[/i] leader of the [[Imperium of Man]], attempting to hold it together after the galaxy was split in two by the [i]Cicatrix Maledictum[/i] at the wake of Abaddon's 13th Black Crusade and the Fall of Cadia.

Fans will often give him nicknames such as "Rowboat Gill-man", "Big Bobby G" or "Girlyman" given the difficulties in correctly spelling or pronouncing his name, and he has been periodically shipped with an [[Eldar]] named [[Yvraine]] due to her role in his resurrection.

h6. Wargear and other commonly used tags: 
(Text taken from https://wh40k.lexicanum.com. Tags added.)

[quote]It is known that at the height of his power during the Horus Heresy, Guilliman was armed with the Hand of Dominion — a mighty power gauntlet[13] that with Guilliman's strength could fell a Titan[14], the Gladius Incandor — a blade of exceptional craftsmanship and a symbol of his Legion and also - with an Arbitrator, a customised combi-bolter.[13] For protection, Guilliman wore a suit of [[Power_Armor|Power_Armour]] known as the [[Armour_of_Reason]].[15]

Upon his resurrection at the end of the 41st Millennium Guilliman continued to use the Hand of Dominion but took up the [[Emperor's_Sword_(warhammer)|Emperor's_Sword]] as his primary weapon. In addition, he now wears the [[Armour_of_Fate]], the very device that allowed him to heal the injuries sustained by Fulgrim ten thousand years earlier.[/quote]
other_names: ロブート・グィリマン

title: methuss
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]].

[b]MSA-005 Methuss[/b]

The first combat ready transformable aerospace [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed by [[Anaheim Electronics]] for the [[AEUG]].

It served as a testbed for the transforming mechanisms later used in the [[zeta_gundam_(mobile_suit)|Zeta Gundam]] and its descendants. Some yellow Methuss were assigned to the [[Argama]] during the Gryps Conflict and were primarily piloted by [[Fa Yuiry]] and [[Reccoa Londe]].

The Methuss's design and reliable transformation would eventually lead to the cutting edge [[ReZEL]] operated by the [[earth_federation_space_forces|EFSF]].

h4. Variants
* [[Methuss Kai]]
* [[Methuss Mariner]]

h4. Related MS development

title: pale_skin
body:
Having skin that is [b]significantly[/b] lighter in tone than the usual Caucasian/Asian skintone, or skin which appears "bleached," lacking in color. For characters with completely white skin, use [[white skin]].

Pale skin, in most cultures, is associated with nobility since they did not spend a lot of time outside and did not get the [[tan|tanned]] skin the commoners have.

A good example of a character usually drawn with pale skin is [[Ayanami Rei]].

title: limousine
body:
A limousine, or limo for short, is a large luxury vehicle driven by a [[chauffeur]] with a partition between the driver's compartment and the passenger's compartment.  Most recognizable are stretch limousines, which are longer than regular limousines to usually accommodate more passengers.

Stretch limousines are created by modifying an existing motor vehicle and extending the passenger area of it.  Usually [[car]]s are used as the base vehicle, but other vehicles such as [[sports utility vehicle]]s are also used to make stretch limousines.

The tag should be used if the exterior of the limousine is seen, use [[limousine interior]] if only the interior is depicted.

h4. External link

* "Wikipedia - Limousine":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Limousine]

title: hirasawa_susumu
body:
A Japanese electronic musician usually known for composing music for [i][[Berserk]][/i], [i][[Paprika]][/i], [i][[sennen joyuu|Millennium Actress]][/i], and [i][[mousou dairinin|Paranoia Agent]][/i]. He started the band known as [i][[P-MODEL]][/i] in 1979.

[i][[K-On!]][/i] makes references to P-MODEL through the five main characters' surnames. Many [i]K-On![/i] fan works make reference to this, with examples of fan works making references to Hirasawa Susumu using [[Hirasawa Yui]] found in posts such as post #481261 and post #480735.

He "once":http://twitter.com/hirasawa/status/5170026790 made mention of Yui on his Twitter:

[quote]
[i]間違えてないか？私は平沢進だぞ。平沢唯じゃない。
Are you mistaken? I am Hirasawa Susumu, NOT Hirasawa Yui.[/i]
[/quote]

h4. Discography
